item.text: (5:20) Then the Lord spoke to Moses:

“When a person sins and commits a trespass against the Lord by deceiving his fellow citizen in regard to something held in trust, or a pledge, or something stolen, or by extorting something from his fellow citizen,

<st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> has <st data-num="04672" class="">found</st> <st data-num="09" class="">something lost</st> and <st data-num="03584" class="">denies</st> it and <st data-num="07650" class="">swears</st> <st data-num="05921 08267">falsely</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">concerning</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of <st data-num="03605" class="">the things</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0120" class="">someone</st> might <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> to <st data-num="02398" class="">sin</st><n id="2" />—

<st data-num="03588" class="">when</st> it <st data-num="01961" class="">happens</st> that he <st data-num="02398" class="">sins</st> and he <st data-num="0816" class="">is</st> found <st data-num="0816" class="">guilty</st>,<n id="1" /> then he must <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st> <st data-num="01500 0834">whatever</st> he had <st data-num="01497" class="">stolen</st>, <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="06233 0834">whatever</st> he had <st data-num="06231" class="">extorted</st>, <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> the <st data-num="06487 0834">thing that</st> he had <st data-num="06487" class="">held in trust</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> the <st data-num="09" class="">lost thing</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> he had <st data-num="04672" class="">found</st>,

<st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">anything</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">about</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> he <st data-num="07650" class="">swears</st> <st data-num="08267" class="">falsely</st>.<n id="1" /> He must <st data-num="07999" class="">restore</st> it in <st data-num="07218" class="">full</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03254" class="">add</st> <st data-num="02549" class="">one-fifth</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> it; he must <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> it to <st data-num="01931" class="">its</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">owner</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">when</st> he is found <st data-num="0819" class="">guilty</st>.<n id="3" />
Then he must bring his guilt offering to the Lord, a flawless ram from the flock, convertible into silver shekels, for a guilt offering to the priest.
So the priest will make atonement on his behalf before the Lord and he will be forgiven for whatever he has done to become guilty.”
(6:1) Then the Lord spoke to Moses:

“<st data-num="06680" class="">Command</st> <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> and his <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>, ‘<st data-num="02063" class="">This</st> is the <st data-num="08451" class="">law</st> of the <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st>. The <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st> is to remain <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04169" class="">hearth</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="01242" class="">morning</st>, and the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> must be kept <st data-num="03344" class="">burning</st> on it.<n id="2" />

Then the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> must <st data-num="03847" class="">put on</st> his <st data-num="0906" class="">linen</st> <st data-num="04055" class="">robe</st> and must <st data-num="03847" class="">put</st> <st data-num="0906" class="">linen</st> <st data-num="04370" class="">leggings</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> his <st data-num="01320" class="">bare flesh</st>, and he must <st data-num="07311" class="">take up</st> the <st data-num="01880" class="">fatty ashes</st> of the <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">consumed</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>,<n id="2" /> and he must <st data-num="07760" class="">place</st> them<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0681" class="">beside</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>.

Then he must <st data-num="06584" class="">take off</st> his <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st> and <st data-num="03847" class="">put on</st> <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st>, and he must <st data-num="03318" class="">bring</st> the <st data-num="01880" class="">fatty ashes</st> <st data-num="0413 02351">outside</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> a <st data-num="02889" class="">ceremonially clean</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st>,

but the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> which is <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> must be kept <st data-num="03344" class="">burning</st> on it.<n id="1" /> It must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="03518" class="">extinguished</st>. So the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> must <st data-num="01197" class="">kindle</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> it <st data-num="01242" class="">morning</st> by <st data-num="01242" class="">morning</st>, and he must <st data-num="06186" class="">arrange</st> the <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> it and <st data-num="06999" class="">offer</st> the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> of the <st data-num="08002" class="">peace offering</st> <st data-num="06999" class="">up in smoke</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> it.
A continual fire must be kept burning on the altar. It must not be extinguished.
“‘This is the law of the grain offering. The sons of Aaron are to present it before the Lord in front of the altar,

and the priest must take up with his hand some of the choice wheat flour of the grain offering and some of its olive oil, and all of the frankincense that is on the grain offering, and he must offer its memorial portion up in smoke on the altar as a soothing aroma to the Lord.

<st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> and his <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> are to <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> what is <st data-num="03498" class="">left over</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> it. It must be <st data-num="0398" class="">eaten</st> <st data-num="04682" class="">unleavened</st> in a <st data-num="06918" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st>; they are to <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it in the <st data-num="02691" class="">courtyard</st> of the <st data-num="04150" class="">Meeting</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">Tent</st>.

It must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="0644" class="">baked</st> with <st data-num="02557" class="">yeast</st>.<n id="1" /> I have <st data-num="05414" class="">given</st> it as their <st data-num="02506" class="">portion</st> from my <st data-num="0801" class="">gifts</st>. <st data-num="01931" class="">It</st> is <st data-num="06944" class="">most</st> <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st>,<n id="2" /> like the <st data-num="02403" class="">sin offering</st> and the <st data-num="0817" class="">guilt offering</st>.
Every male among the sons of Aaron may eat it. It is a perpetual allotted portion throughout your generations from the gifts of the Lord. Anyone who touches these gifts must be holy.’”
Then the Lord spoke to Moses:

“This is the offering of Aaron and his sons which they must present to the Lord on the day when he is anointed: a tenth of an ephah of choice wheat flour as a continual grain offering, half of it in the morning and half of it in the evening.
It must be made with olive oil on a griddle, and you must bring it well soaked, so you must present a grain offering of broken pieces as a soothing aroma to the Lord.
The high priest who succeeds him from among his sons must do it. It is a perpetual statute; it must be offered up in smoke as a whole offering to the Lord.
Every grain offering of a priest must be a whole offering; it must not be eaten.”
Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
“Tell Aaron and his sons, ‘This is the law of the sin offering. In the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered the sin offering must be slaughtered before the Lord. It is most holy.

The <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> who <st data-num="02398" class="">offers</st> it <st data-num="02398" class="">for sin</st> is to <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it. It must be <st data-num="0398" class="">eaten</st> in a <st data-num="06918" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st>, in the <st data-num="02691" class="">courtyard</st> of the <st data-num="04150" class="">Meeting</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">Tent</st>.

<st data-num="03605" class="">Anyone</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="05060" class="">touches</st> its <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st> must <st data-num="06942" class="">be holy</st>, and <st data-num="0834" class="">whoever</st> <st data-num="05137" class="">spatters</st> some of its <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> a <st data-num="0899" class="">garment</st><n id="1" /> must <st data-num="03526" class="">wash</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">whatever</st> he <st data-num="05137" class="">spatters</st> it <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> in a <st data-num="06918" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st>.

Any <st data-num="02789" class="">clay</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">vessel</st> it is <st data-num="01310" class="">boiled</st> in must be <st data-num="07665" class="">broken</st>, and <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> it was <st data-num="01310" class="">boiled</st> in a <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">vessel</st>, then that vessel<n id="1" /> must be <st data-num="04838" class="">rubbed out</st> and <st data-num="07857" class="">rinsed</st> in <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>.

<st data-num="03605" class="">Any</st> <st data-num="02145" class="">male</st> among the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> may <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it. It <st data-num="01931" class="">is</st> <st data-num="06944" class="">most</st> <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st>.<n id="1" />
But any sin offering from which some of its blood is brought into the Meeting Tent to make atonement in the sanctuary must not be eaten. It must be burned up in the fire.
